intro: Hieracium holmboeanum, commonly known as Holmboe's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-haired leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single, erect head. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The plant is perennial and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
